prop.head.label.name: Part
prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

head.headtext: Initiating Panel proceedings—Method and proof of service

para.paratext: All papers filed with the Panel, including the initial motion for transfer, must be accompanied by proof of service.[1] Service of the motion to transfer must be made on all other parties in all the actions involved in the litigation and the proof of service must show the names and addresses of the persons served and the names of the parties represented by attorneys who are served. The rules also require for motions to transfer and motions to remand that the proof of service certify that copies of the motion have been mailed to or filed with the clerk of each court in which an action to be affected by the motion is pending as required by J.P.M.L. R. 6.1(a).[2] The rules require that proof of service be included in all pleadings.[3]

In the ECF system, service is effected by filing. Under Panel Rule 4.1(a), the Panel's Notice of Filing constitutes service on all counsel. Service should be made to all parties appearing on the Panel's Panel Service List,[4] which is provided to all parties at the time the Panel proceedings are commenced. The moving party should go to great effort to insure that the Schedule of Actions served with the first motion in the case is accurate so that the Panel Service List is as complete and accurate as possible. A party who is entitled to notice of a transfer motion and who does not receive notice has valid grounds for objection to transfer. In one case the Panel determined that the omitted party was not prejudiced by nonservice since it did learn of the motion, filed a brief, and even appeared at oral argument.[5] In other circumstances, however, the failure to give a party notice may be more problematical for the Panel and for the parties.
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
J.P.M.L. R. 5.2(a). The Panel rules are reproduced in § 4:34.
J.P.M.L. R. 4.1(a). The Panel rules are reproduced in § 4:34.
J.P.M.L. R. 4.1(a). The Panel rules are reproduced in § 4:34. A form of proof of service suggested by the Panel is included in Appendix A.
A sample Panel Service List appears in Appendix A.
See In re Sta-Power Industries Securities and Antitrust Litigation, 372 F. Supp. 1398, 1400 (J.P.M.L. 1974).
